alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Coastal Camden; Inland Camden; Northeastern Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 8:41PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Camden, southeastern Brantley and northeastern Charlton Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 840 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 8 miles southeast of Hickox, or 11 miles south of Nahunta, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Woodbine, Waverly, Tarboro and Colesburg. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Coastal Camden; Inland Camden; Northeastern Charlton
